results.title: Geokids
results.creator_credit: Hank Saroyan, Caroline Somers, Bruce Somers Jnr and Lost Kitty Productions
results.brief_description: Created by Han Saroyan of the “Muppet babies”, this series features three amazingly life-like animal characters called Sunny, Bobby and Balzac. Small children are able to learn about many different types of animals and the way they behave.

results.title: Geography of the Americas
results.brief_description: A series of instructional films relating to the geography, economy and peoples of the Americas, including North America, Central America and South America.

results.title: Geography of South America: the continent
results.brief_description: The main geographical features of South America, including the Andes, the Guiana and Brazilian highlands, and the Orinoco, Amazon and Plata-Parana River Basions. The relationships of these geographic factors to the people and their ways of life. Survey of agriculture, industry, commerce, cities and culture.

results.title: Geography of South America: countries of the Andes
results.brief_description: Views of the mountains, the highlands and the people against a historical and geographical survey of Bolivia, Ecuador, Peru and Chile. The main topographical regions in relationship to the resources and cultural development of these Andean nations, pointing out that although primitive in many respects, these countries hold the promise of a bright and prosperous future.

results.title: Geography of South America: Brazil. - Rev. ed.
results.brief_description: Designed to show the great variety of urban and rural life styles which exist in Brazil. Depicts life in the vast Amazon Basin, on coffee and cocoa plantations, in the great coastal cities, and in Brazilia. The Brazilian economy is painted in glowing terms. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Geography of South America: Brazil
results.brief_description: The geographic features of Brazil and their relationship to such important crops as coffee, cotton and cacao; Brazil as a land of impenetrable jungle, fertile farmlands, gigantic plantations, rich mineral resources, thriving industry and big cities. Includes a sequence on Brasilia, the new capital.

results.title: Geography of South America: Argentina, Paraguay, Uraguay
results.brief_description: The geographic factors influencing the economy and life of Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay, pointing out that the three nations of the Plata-Parana River system are rich in flat and rolling lands suitable for farming and grazing. Some of the achievements and problems of these countries are also discussed.

results.title: Geography of Australia
results.brief_description: A detailed examination of the geography of Australia; surrounding oceans; its area, rainfall and wind systems resulting in various climatic regions, temperature variations; main mineral resources and the uses to which these resources are put; chief rural industries. Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Gently down the stream
results.creator_credit: Education Department Western Australia and Ray Costello
results.brief_description: Shows a Year 10 canoeing expedition on the river from Mt Franklin to the Noralup inlet, Western Australia. Demonstrates that the focus of the Outdoor Education Project is preparation for expeditions; and shows the basic understandings for wilderness and adventure activities.
